definition: tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: It is a dense material – different from surrounding soil – and therefore discernible.
sentences.chinese: 和普通的泥塊不同，泥磚是一種十分緊實的材料。

sentences.english: Almost had to use a bottle, some tight chest than before.
sentences.chinese: 差不多曾經用了一瓶，胸部較之前有些緊實。

sentences.english: Finshing with soft tannins the wine has great length and structure.
sentences.chinese: 單寧柔和，餘味悠長，結構緊實。

sentences.english: A frank attack that opens out onto tight tannins with a typical robust structure of the Medoc.
sentences.chinese: 飽滿濃郁，單寧緊實，典型的梅多克強勁歷練的結構。

sentences.english: “I wanted everything to look fresh and tight, ” she said.
sentences.chinese: 她說，”我想要看起來清爽緊實。

sentences.english: The richness and intensity of the flavor linger long and harmoniously on the palate.
sentences.chinese: 濃郁緊實的風味於味蕾上綿延留連，和諧而悠長。

sentences.english: The thick, dense coats of a sloth help keep them dry during the rainy season.
sentences.chinese: 樹懶厚而緊實的皮膚讓它們在雨季的時候保持乾燥。

sentences.english: Trim and tone those trouble spots with the inner and outer thigh attachment.
sentences.chinese: 修飾和緊實那些出現問題的內外大腿贅肉。

definition: to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
flexible/not rigid/spongy/soft or runny (not set hard)/loose (soil)
to put on weight/to get fat
